intro: Gastridium ventricosum subsp. scabrum, commonly known as the rough gastridium, is a flowering plant species native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, two-lipped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or along streambanks. Its subspecies scabrum is distinguished by its rough, scabrous texture on the leaves, which gives it its common name. The plant is relatively small, with erect stems and clusters of bright blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer months.
